intro: Alphonsea teysmannii, commonly known as the Java alphonsea, is a deciduous tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and compound leaves with three to five leaflets. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by orange-red drupes. Its botanical features make it an important species in tropical ecosystems, though it is less commonly cultivated for ornamental purposes.
